intro: Mouriri guianensis subsp. barinensis, commonly known as the Guianan mouriri, is a species of flowering plant in the family Chrysobalanaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly in Guyana and parts of Brazil. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within lowland forests. The fruit is a capsule that contains several small, hard seeds.
